original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Tuesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.96 percent or 88.14 points to 9,099.15, while S&P SL20 was down 1.16 percent or 31.11 points to 2,652.64.
The turnover generated at 1230 hours was 699 million rupees.
At the previous session, the market was waiting for quarterly performance reports and clarity on local debt restructuring, an analyst said.
Top losers during mid day trade were Expolanka, Sampath Bank and Ceylon Tobacco Company. (Colombo/April25/2023)
